xxl.applications.indexStructures
Class MTreeTest

java.lang.Object
  xxl.applications.indexStructures.MTreeTest

public class MTreeTest
extends Object

Creates a flexible, disk resident M-Tree or Slim-Tree and performs exact match, range and nearest neighbor queries on it. Furthermore a detailed performance evaluation is implemented, so the time for building and filling the complete M-Tree, as well I/O-operations to external memory and buffers, as the time for the different query evaluations is determined.

Data: The M-Tree indexes 10000 entries of type DoublePoint, a high dimensional point, which are extracted from the dataset rr_small.bin lying in the directory xxl\data. rr_small.bin contains a sample of minimal bounding rectangles (mbr) from railroads in Los Angeles, i.e., the entries are of type KPE. So all entries have to be converted to DoublePoints at first, using the mapping functions and factory methods provided by this class. Another dataset, called st_small.bin, located in the same directory is used for query evaluation. It also contains KPE objects, but they represent mbr's of streets.

Insertion: Elements delivered by input cursor iterating over the external dataset rr_small.bin can be inserted into the M-Tree using two different strategies:

  • tuple insertion: each element of the input cursor is inserted separately
  • bulk insertion: quantities of elements are inserted at once
When using sort-based bulk insertion the user is able to choose different compare modes: given order, by x-axis, by peano-value or by hilbert-value.

Queries:

  • exact match queries:
    1000 exact match queries are performed, taking 1000 KPEs from st_small.bin, converting them to DoublePoints and querying target level 0 of the M-Tree, i.e., only leaf nodes will be returned.
  • range queries:
    1000 range queries are performed, taking 1000 KPEs from st_small.bin and converting them to Spheres, such that a sphere covers the rectangle belonging to a KPE, i.e., the center of the sphere is set to the center of the rectangle. These spheres represent descriptors. The descriptors are used for the query at any specified target level in the M-Tree.
  • nearest neighbor queries:
    A nearest neighbor query is also executed. Therefore a sphere resulting by applying a mapping function to an input element delivered from the input cursor iterating over st_small.bin is used as a query object, to which the fifty nearest neighbors will be determined. For this realization a priority queue (dynamic heap) based on a special comparator defining an order on the distances of arbitrary points to the query object is made use of.

Parameters:

  • 1.) minimum capacity of nodes
  • 2.) maximum capacity of nodes
  • 3.) insertion type: tuple or bulk (different compare modes)
  • 4.) buffersize (number of node-objects)
  • 5.) target level for queries. Default: 0
  • 6.) split strategy
  • 7.) type of tree: MTree or SlimTree

Example usage: 

        java -Dxxlrootpath=W:\\dev\\xxl.cvs\\xxl -Dxxloutpath=W:\\dev\\xxl.out\\ xxl.applications.indexStructures.MTreeTest minCap=10 maxCap=25 insertType=bulk_hilbert bufSize=256 level=0 slimTree

        or:

        xxl xxl.applications.indexStructures.MTreeTest minCap=10 maxCap=25 insertType=bulk_hilbert bufSize=256 level=0 slimTree
For further parameters and settings of default values type: 
        java xxl.applications.indexStructures.MTreeTest /?

See Also:
Iterator, Comparator, Container, Function, MTree, ORTree, SlimTree, Sphere, Tree, Converter, LRUBuffer, DoublePoint, KPE, Point, Rectangle

An rectangle containing all data rectangles. Needed for peano-/hilbert value computation.

LEAFENTRY_FACTORY

public static Function LEAFENTRY_FACTORY
A factory method to be invoked with one parameter of type KPE and returning an instance of the class DoublePoint, namely the midpoint of the rectangle belonging to the given KPE.

SPHERE_COVERING_RECTANGLE_FACTORY

public static Function SPHERE_COVERING_RECTANGLE_FACTORY
A factory method to be invoked with one parameter of type KPE and returning an instance of the class Sphere covering the whole rectangle.

getDescriptor

public static Function getDescriptor
An unary factory method that returns a descriptor for a given point. That means a new Sphere is generated containing the given point as its center.

Constructor Detail

MTreeTest

public MTreeTest()
Method Detail

centerConverter

public static Converter centerConverter(int dimension)
Returns a converter that serializes the center of sphere objects. In this case the center of a sphere is an high-dimensional DoublePoint.
This converter is used by the M-Tree to read/write leaf nodes to external memory.

Parameters:
dimension - the dimension of the DoublePoint representing the center of the sphere
Returns:
a converter serializing DoublePoints

descriptorConverter

public static Converter descriptorConverter(int dimension)
Returns a converter that serializes the descriptors of the M-Tree, i.e., spheres This converter is used by the M-Tree to read/write index nodes to external memory

Parameters:
dimension - the dimension of the DoublePoint representing the center of the sphere
Returns:
a converter serializing spheres

getMidPoint

public static DoublePoint getMidPoint(KPE kpe)
Determining the midpoint of the rectangle belonging to the given KPE object.

Parameters:
kpe - the KPE object delivering the rectangle
Returns:
the midpoint of the given rectangle

getDistanceBasedComparator

public static Comparator getDistanceBasedComparator(Sphere queryObject)
Returns a comparator which evaluates the distance of two candidate objects to the specified queryObject. This comparator is used for nearest neighbor queries and defines an order on candidate- descriptors. With the help of a priority queue (Min-heap) and this comparator the nearest neighbor query can be performed.

Parameters:
queryObject - a sphere to which the nearest neighbors should be determined
Returns:
a comparator defining an order on candidate objects

argsToProperties

public static Properties argsToProperties(Properties defaultProps,
                                          String[] args)
This method is used to set the properties for the application.

Parameters:
defaultProps - default properties
args - user defined properties
Returns:
new properties for the application

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
The main method builds an M-Tree/Slim-Tree and executes various kinds of queries on it.

Parameters:
args - command line parameters
Throws:
Exception
